name: GraphQL Features Demo
description: Comprehensive demonstration of GraphQL mocking features including schemas, resolvers, mutations, and subscriptions

mocks.name: GraphQL - Basic Schema with Query Resolver
mocks.description: Demonstrates schema-based mocking with a simple query resolver

mocks.name: GraphQL - Multiple Query Resolvers
mocks.description: Demonstrates multiple query resolvers for different fields

mocks.name: GraphQL - Mutation Resolvers
mocks.description: Demonstrates mutation resolvers with input handling

mocks.name: GraphQL - Nested Object Resolution
mocks.description: Demonstrates deeply nested object structures

mocks.name: GraphQL - List/Array Responses
mocks.description: Demonstrates various list response patterns

mocks.name: GraphQL - Error Responses
mocks.description: Demonstrates various error response configurations

mocks.name: GraphQL - Template Variables
mocks.description: Demonstrates template variable support (uuid, now, args)

mocks.name: GraphQL - Response Delays
mocks.description: Demonstrates configurable response delays for latency simulation

mocks.name: GraphQL - Enum Types
mocks.description: Demonstrates enum type handling

mocks.name: GraphQL - Union Types
mocks.description: Demonstrates union type handling

mocks.name: GraphQL - Interface Types
mocks.description: Demonstrates interface type handling

mocks.name: GraphQL - Input Object Types
mocks.description: Demonstrates complex input object handling

mocks.name: GraphQL - Subscriptions with Events
mocks.description: Demonstrates WebSocket subscription support with event streaming

mocks.name: GraphQL - Subscriptions with Timing
mocks.description: Demonstrates subscription timing configurations (fixed delay, random delay, repeat)

mocks.name: GraphQL - Custom Scalar Types
mocks.description: Demonstrates custom scalar type definitions

graphql.schema:
scalar DateTime
scalar Date
scalar Time
scalar JSON
scalar BigInt
scalar Decimal
scalar UUID
scalar Email
scalar URL
scalar PhoneNumber

type Query {
  event(id: ID!): Event
  config: JSON
  transaction(id: ID!): Transaction
}

type Event {
  id: UUID!
  name: String!
  startDateTime: DateTime!
  endDateTime: DateTime!
  date: Date!
  time: Time!
  metadata: JSON
}

type Transaction {
  id: UUID!
  amount: Decimal!
  largeAmount: BigInt!
  timestamp: DateTime!
  contactEmail: Email
  callbackUrl: URL
  phone: PhoneNumber
}

mocks.name: GraphQL - Introspection Disabled
mocks.description: Demonstrates a GraphQL endpoint with introspection disabled

Query.secretData.response: This is secret data that should not be discoverable via introspection

mocks.name: GraphQL - Directive Definitions
mocks.description: Demonstrates schema with custom directive definitions

mocks.name: GraphQL - Full E-Commerce Example
mocks.description: Comprehensive e-commerce API demonstrating all features together

mocks.name: GraphQL - Nullable vs Non-Nullable Fields
mocks.description: Demonstrates nullable and non-nullable field handling

graphql.schema:
type Query {
  user(id: ID!): User
  optionalUser(id: ID): User
  requiredUsers: [User!]!
  optionalUsers: [User]
  mixedList: [User]!
}

type User {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  nickname: String
  email: String!
  phone: String
  address: Address
  tags: [String!]!
  optionalTags: [String]
}

type Address {
  street: String!
  city: String!
  zipCode: String
  country: String!
}

mocks.name: GraphQL - Fragment Support
mocks.description: Schema designed to work well with fragment queries

graphql.schema:
type Query {
  user(id: ID!): User
  post(id: ID!): Post
  comment(id: ID!): Comment
}

interface Node {
  id: ID!
  createdAt: String!
  updatedAt: String!
}

type User implements Node {
  id: ID!
  createdAt: String!
  updatedAt: String!
  name: String!
  email: String!
  avatar: String
  posts: [Post!]!
}

type Post implements Node {
  id: ID!
  createdAt: String!
  updatedAt: String!
  title: String!
  content: String!
  author: User!
  comments: [Comment!]!
}

type Comment implements Node {
  id: ID!
  createdAt: String!
  updatedAt: String!
  text: String!
  author: User!
  post: Post!
}
